commitsDetails.commitMessage: avoid possible CCE when hg4idea plugin disabled. fix #592

issues.title: Incorrect parsing of ${} symbols in gitignore
issues.body: ### Prerequisites * [x] Plugin is in the latest version * [x] Issue was not reported yet * [x] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name ### Description Using a mix of `$`, `{` and `}` symbols within `.gitignore` files causes a parsing error within a plugin. ### Steps to Reproduce Create a `.gitignore` file with this contents: ``` ${}/ ``` **Expected behavior:** Valid gitignore file that ignores all directories named (literally) `${}`. **Actual behavior:** Error syntax highlight within a file: **Reproduces how often:** Always reproducible ### Versions **Plugin:** ``` 3.1.2.191 ``` **IDE:** ``` IntelliJ IDEA 2019.1.3 ``` **OS:** ``` macOS Mojave 10.14.5, up to date as of June 20th ```

issues.title: All files are marked as ignored
issues.body:
Just updated to version 3.1.1.191 and all my files are now marked as ignored.
Here is my .gitignore file:

issues.title: Plugin shows incorrect information
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

<!-- Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: -->

* [x] Plugin is in the latest version
* [x] Issue was not reported yet
* [ ] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

The plugin is over-riding the Git ignore data or getting it wrong. Files that should be tracked are showing as ignored in the IDE when this plugin is enabled.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a new project 
1. Create a directory, `parent`
1. Create a subdirectory under `parent`, `notignored`
1. Create a subdirectory under notignored, `subdirectory`
1. Put a file called `test.txt` in both `notignored` and `subdirectory`
1. Put the following codeblock in `.gitignore` in the `parent` directory

```bash
# Exclude everything
*
!.gitignore

# Whitelist include
!notignored
!notignored/**

```

**Expected behavior:**

The plugin should show the correct ignored information as per Git

**Actual behavior:** 

Files that are not ignored by Git are showing as ignored in the Project view AND in the banner when editing the files.

Turning the plugin off restores the expected behaviour. Since I need accurate information in the files more than I need the auto-creation, I've disabled the plugin.

**Reproduces how often:** 

100% of the time

### Versions

**Plugin:** 

`v2.6.2`

**IDE:** 

`PhpStorm 2019.1`

**OS:** 

Mac 10.14.4

### Additional Information

Screenshot showing this in action.

![gitignore-plugin-error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1715284/55921973-83c78a00-5c42-11e9-80b8-a4f240657a0a.png)

edit 1: Fixed the checkbox display

issues.title: Files are flagged as ignored while they are not
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Plugin is in the latest version
* [x] Issue was not reported yet
* [ ] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

There is something wrong with .gitignore files in subdirectories when the .gitignore file contains:

```
*
!.gitignore
```

In such cases, it seems that all the files having a name starting with the name of the subdirectory will be considered as ignored by the plugin.

I created a toy example that reproduces this issue 100% of the time, cf Steps to Reproduce section.

### Steps to Reproduce

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11029979/48545140-7f7e8700-e8c5-11e8-8496-e95204e79494.png)

**Expected behavior:**

The foobar.py and foobar_2.py are not flagged as ignored.

**Actual behavior:** 

They are flagged as ignored.

**Reproduces how often:** 

100%


### Versions

**Plugin:** 
```
Version: 3.0.0.182
```

**IDE:** 

```
PyCharm 2018.2.5 (Community Edition)
Build #PC-182.5107.22, built on November 13, 2018
JRE: 1.8.0_152-release-1248-b22 x86_64
JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
macOS 10.12.6

* [ ] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

False positive...

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add to directory any archive, say 7z-file.
2. Add .gitignore file like:
```
*/
*.7z
```
3. Open .gitignore in Pycharm.

**Expected behavior:**

No errors.

**Actual behavior:**
 
line with *.7z in the .gitignore file will be highlighted with message '*.7z' is covered by '*/'.  7z-file will be shown in the project pane as ignored. If remove this line from .gitignore, 7z-file in the project view will be untracked. So the problem is with the visualization of .gitignore file only.

**Reproduces how often:** 

100%

### Versions

**Plugin:** 
```
v3.0.0.182
```
**IDE:**

Pycharm 2018.3 EAP 7
```

Windows 7.1 64 bit

issues.title: .gitignore entries using wildcard never considered as used
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Plugin is in the latest version
* [x] Issue was not reported yet
* [ ] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name

### Description

In a .gitignore file, entries like e.g. `foo/*/baz.txt` are never considered used despite they do match a file (the file appears as ignored in the Project view and `git status` does not report it as untracked).

The issue does not occur if the wildcard is used along with some explicit characters, e.g. `foo/ba*/baz.txt`.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create the following file in your project: `aaa/bbb/ccc.txt`
2. Add the following entry to .gitignore file: `aaa/*/ccc.txt`
3. Notice that the file is correctly ignored: everything works as expected but the entry is considered unused
4. Change the entry to `aaa/b*/ccc.txt`
5. Now everything works as expected *and* the entry is considered used


**Expected behavior:** I expect the entry to be considered used at step 3 and 5.

**Actual behavior:** The entry is considered used at step 5 only.

**Reproduces how often:** always.


### Versions

**Plugin:** 2.6.1
**IDE:** 2018.1.2
**OS:** Ubuntu 16.04

### Prerequisites

### Description

Infinite loops of index runs (every ~10 sec), each accompanied with the following log entries:

```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Update .ignore Plugin to latest version (2.5)
2. Open any Project in PHPStorm


**Expected behavior:** Index runs once, then finishes, as nothing changed

**Actual behavior:** Infinite index reruns (every ~10 sec)

**Reproduces how often:** 100%


### Versions

**Plugin:** 2.5

**IDE:** PHPStorm 2018.1 / 2017.3.6

**OS:** macOS 10.13.3 / 10.13.4


### Additional Information

Removing .ignore Plugin and manual reinstall of version 2.4 ~~fixed the index problem.~~ does not fix the problem completely, but the NullPointerException with subsequent index rebuild occurs only occasionally.

[idea.log](https://github.com/hsz/idea-gitignore/files/1874882/idea.log)

#527 Immutable IgnoreEntryOccurrence with immutable items, fixed hashCode calculation

#527 Fix for Performance warning: LineMarker is supposed to be registered for leaf elements only

issues.title: Opening multiple projects in a new window makes IDEA plug-in unresponsive
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Plugin is in the latest version 
* [x] Issue was not reported yet
* [ ] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

Opening multiple projects into a new window, with the .ignore plugin (idea-ignore) enabled, causes my Mac to become unresponsive to the point where I can only force quit Jetbrains IntelliJ. This only happens after opening a second IntelliJ project in a new window.

Uninstalling the .ignore plugin resolves the issue.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Launch a project using IntilliJ IDEA.
1. Open a `.gitignore` file in the IntelliJ IDEA project.
1. Click _File > Open Recent_ then choose another project from the recent projects list.
1. In the _Open Project_ dialog, click the _New Window_ button.
1. Open a `.gitignore` file in the second, newly opened project.

**Expected behavior:** _What you expect to happen_

I should be able to switch between the two projects, allowing me to copy code from the `.gitignore` file in one project, to the `.gitignore` file in another project.

**Actual behavior:** _What actually happens_

The Mac OS pinwheel appears and IntelliJ IDEA becomes unresponsive. I cannot switch windows, from one project to the other. The IntelliJ IDEA menus become unresponsive, and I cannot click the Window Close buttons at the top of the window.

The only way to recover is to Force Quit IntelliJ IDEA from the Mac OS Dock.

**Reproduces how often:** _What percentage of the time does it reproduce?_

This happens almost always, when working with my current projects. I'm not sure if they have large file system trees that are being traversed, or large indexes. I have not tried with dummy projects containing very few indexed files.

### Versions

**Plugin:** 

.idea v2.3.2 (2017-11-17)

**IDE:** 

IntelliJ IDEA 2017.3.2 (Ultimate Edition)
Build #IU-173.4127.27, built on December 26, 2017
Licensed to ~~redacted~~
Subscription is active until July 14, 2018
JRE: 1.8.0_152-release-1024-b8 x86_64
JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
Mac OS X 10.12.6

**OS:** 


System Software Overview:

  System Version:	macOS 10.12.6 (16G1114)
  Kernel Version:	Darwin 16.7.0
  Boot Volume:	Macintosh HD
  Boot Mode:	Normal
  Computer Name:	~~redacted~~
  User Name:	~~redacted~~
  Secure Virtual Memory:	Enabled
  System Integrity Protection:	Enabled
  Time since boot:	2 days 6:18


### Additional Information

Hardware Overview:

  Model Name:	MacBook Pro
  Model Identifier:	MacBookPro11,4
  Processor Name:	Intel Core i7
  Processor Speed:	2.2 GHz
  Number of Processors:	1
  Total Number of Cores:	4
  L2 Cache (per Core):	256 KB
  L3 Cache:	6 MB
  Memory:	16 GB
  Boot ROM Version:	MBP114.0172.B09
  SMC Version (system):	2.29f24

issues.title: Gitignore may be breaking Jetbrains index caches
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

<!-- Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: -->

* [x] Plugin is in the latest version
* [x] Issue was not reported yet

### Description

The devs on YouTrack believe this is an issue with .gitignore: https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/115000626684-Almost-every-day-PHPStorm-forgets-all-classes-und-functions-until-invalidate-cache-?page=1#community_comment_115000596790

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install plugin in webstorm or phpstorm
2. Complete file index
3. Quit IDE, Reboot, IDE index cache is broken

**Expected behavior:** 

Does not break IDE index cache.

**Actual behavior:** 

Break IDE index cache.

**Reproduces how often:** _What percentage of the time does it reproduce?_

Every time

### Versions

 2.3.0

Webstorm 2017.2
Phpstorm 2017.2
Mac OS

the plugin seems to be contributing the wrong  entry in the color scheme settings (see attached image).

issues.title: Plugin makes IDE too slow
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

<!-- Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: -->

* [X] Plugin is in the latest version
* [X] Issue was not reported yet
* [ ] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

A month ago or so my PhpStorm started to work extremely slow. Almost any action like scrolling or pressing buttons was performed after significant delay. I tried to disable as many plugins as possible and finally got that .ignore plugin slows IDE. Enabling slows, disabling it removes the issue.
No any visible error logs. No indexation. It happens in a few minutes (maybe, ten) after restarting IDE.

### Versions

**Plugin:** 

```
The latest at the moment version (2.2.2). The same happened in previous versions.
```

**IDE:** 

```
2017.2.4
```

**OS:** 

```
Ubuntu 16.04
```

```

https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-180954

Practical advice: for responsiveness code that runs inspection should periodically check for cancelability via call to ProgressManager.checkCancelled(); 
If user wants to type then this code will throw ProcessCancelledException that will be propagated by call stack (no need to catch or log for this exception).
Tips for calling ProgressManager.checkCancelled(): every file system scan once in directory, every larger loop, etc

issues.title: Bug is back: Popup saying that ignored files are in .gitignore
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

* [x] Plugin is in the latest version
* [x] Issue was not reported yet
* [ ] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

Whenever I open a project, there's a message saying <<Ignored files found that are tracked: .ignore plugin found some files that are tracked with Git which are also listed in .gitignore file>>

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open a PHPStorm project

**Expected behavior:** 
I expected the popup to appear only when appropriate and list the files that are tracked and in .gitignor

**Actual behavior:** 
Empty dialog opens.

**Reproduces how often:** 
Every time


### Versions

**Plugin:** 
2.2.2

**IDE:** 
PhpStorm 2017.3 EAP
Build #PS-173.3188.26, built on October 11, 2017
PhpStorm EAP User
Expiration date: November 10, 2017
JRE: 1.8.0_152-release-1024-b5 x86_64
JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
Mac OS X 10.13.1

**OS:** 
10.13.1

### Additional Information

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #486 Ignored & tracked dialog shows empty files list

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open project in WebStorm
2. Select .gitignore from Project tree OR use menu to interact with .gitignore ie: add file to .gitignore 

**Expected behavior:** 
Does not crash
**Actual behavior:** 
WebStorm becomes unresponsive and requires force quit; occasionally displays 'Out of Memory' window.
**Reproduces how often:**
100%

### Versions

**Plugin:** 
```
.ignore 2.2.2, 2.2.1, 2.2.0
```

**IDE:** 

```
WebStorm 2017.2.4
```

**OS:** 

```
MacOS 10.13 High Sierra (Tested with current update, and another, one update behind)
```


### Additional Information

Stack trace is from .ignore 2.2.0. Issue arose after .ignore update to 2.2.2. Downgraded to 2.2.1, and then again to 2.2.0 after issue persisted. Stack traces for higher versions were unavailable.

issues.title: The .upignore should not tell the IDE to actually ignore files
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

<!-- Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: -->

* [X] Plugin is in the latest version
* [X] Issue was not reported yet
* [X] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

The `.upignore` should not tell Intellij to actually ignore files.  While the contents behave like a `.gitignore` file, it is not meant to actually ignore files in the editor.  It is used to provide a whitelist or blacklist of files to include in the build zip.  Example contents from the [docs](https://apex.github.io/up/#configuration__ignoring_files):

```
*
!app.js
!package.json
!node_modules/**
!src/**
```
So, this would ignore all docs, README, etc, when building the zip asset, but it shouldn't tell the IDE to ignore those files as well.

### Steps to Reproduce

I was using PHPStorm.

1. Create an `.upignore`
2. While editing the `.upignore`, get benefits from plugin this regarding paths, etc.

**Expected behavior:** _What you expect to happen_

The paths in `.upignore` do not cause the editor to actually ignore files.  Ideally, you can still apply the benefits of this plugin to the editing of the `.upignore` files.  But, if it is all or nothing, I suggest revert supporting this file.

**Actual behavior:** _What actually happens_

The paths in `.upignore` cause the editor to ignore files.  You then get notifications about editing an ignored file.

**Reproduces how often:** _What percentage of the time does it reproduce?_

100%

### Versions

**Plugin:** 

2.2.1

**IDE:** 

PHPStorm 2017.2.4

**OS:** 

macOS Sierra 10.12.6

issues.title: Accessing 'IgnoreFilesIndex' during processing 'filetypes'.
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

<!-- Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: -->

* [x] Plugin is in the latest version
* [x] Issue was not reported yet
* [x] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

Restarted Android Studio before an update. Android Studio reopened the project I was working on and suddenly almost every codeline had an error that begins with "Cannot resolve... ". The Event Log shown the following:
```
02:31 PM	Gradle sync started

02:31 PM	Plugin Error: .ignore threw an uncaught EmptyThrowable. Disable Plugin

02:31 PM	EmptyThrowable: Accessing 'IgnoreFilesIndex' during processing 'filetypes'. Nested different indices processing may cause deadlock

02:31 PM	Gradle sync completed
```

Projects compile and run on debug mode normally. However, as almost everything is red, it's confusing to the point of annoyance.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. _First Step_ Update .ignore plugin on Android Studio to the latest version
2. _Second Step_ Restart Android Studio
3. _Third Step_ Open any project.


**Expected behavior:** _No errors._

**Actual behavior:** _Exception Error on .ignore plugin._

**Reproduces how often:** _At the start or at the opening of another project. Compiling a project doesn't trigger it._

1. Update to .ignore 2.2.0
2. Restart IntelliJ
3. Observe error


**Expected behavior:** No errors.

**Actual behavior:** Error message seen above.

**Reproduces how often:** Only once so far. Subsequent restarts did not produce error.


### Versions

**Plugin:**
2.2.0

**IDE:** 
IntelliJ IDEA 2017.2.3

JRE: 1.8.0_152-release-915-b11 x86_64

Mac OS X 10.12.6

issues.title: Error on opening .gitignore file
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

<!-- Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: -->

* [x] Plugin is in the latest version
* [x] Issue was not reported yet
* [x] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

After updating the plugin to 2.0.0 today, I opened the .gitignore file in my project and the plugin threw an error.

```java

2. Open the file

issues.title: Freeze PyCharm by indexing after open project
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

<!-- Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: -->

* [x] Plugin is in the latest version
* [x] Issue was not reported yet
* [ ] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

Freeze PyCharm by indexing after open project


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open PyCharrm project with _big_ ignored text files
2. Wait 20-30 seconds
3. Freeze PyCharrm.


**Expected behavior:** Not Freeze

**Actual behavior:** Freeze PyCharrm. Stop can only keel

**Reproduces how often:** Always after upgrade PyCharrm to 2017.2.2 and open project with big text files.

### Versions

**Plugin:** 
```
Version: 2.1.1
```
**IDE:** 
```
PyCharm Pro 2017.2.2

JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
Linux 4.4.0-92-generic
```

**OS:** 
```
OS: Kubuntu 16.04 + KDE neon
```

see https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/PY-25826

issues.title: git exclude file from another project is shown in 'Outer ignore rules'
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

<!-- Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: -->

* [x] Plugin is in the latest version
* [x] Issue was not reported yet
* [ ] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description

_When .gitignore file for the current project is opened in the editor, git 'exclude' files from another project and its submodules are shown in the 'Outer ignore rules' pane next to the .gitignore_global file._


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Invalidate IDE cache.
2. Open some project with a git repo initialized and containing .gitignore and .git/info/exclude files.
3. Open the .gitignore file in the editor.
4. Close that project.
5. Open another project with the similar stuff.
6. Open the .gitignore file in the editor.


**Expected behavior:** _'Outer ignore rules' shows ~/.gitignore_global and 'exclude' files from the current project's repo._

**Actual behavior:** _'Outer ignore rules' shows ~/.gitignore_global and 'exclude' files from the project, that was opened before (first_project/.git/info/exclude and first_project/.git/modules/submodule_name/info/exclude)._

**Reproduces how often:** _Each time._


### Versions

**Plugin:** 2.1.1.

**IDE:** PyCharm CE 2017.2.2.

**OS:** OS X 10.10.5.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #460 - 'Outer ignore rules' shows previous project's exclude files

issues.title: Ignored items in my profile ~/.gitignore_global are no more grayed in the Project view
issues.body:
### Prerequisites

<!-- Put an X between the brackets on this line if you have done all of the following: -->

* [X] Plugin is in the latest version
* [X] Issue was not reported yet
* [ ] Stack trace (if provided) contains `mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore` package name


### Description
With previous version, the excluded items defined in my profile ~/.gitignore_global when grayed in the Project view.
It's no more the case with this new version (2.1.1)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Select a file in your project
2. Use the `Add to .gitignore file` contextual option to add this file in the .gitignore file
3. While editing the .gitignore file, slected the added line and cut it to the clipboard
4. Lower, in the `Outer ignore rules`, edit your profile ~/.gitignore_global
5. Paste the line in the file and save it


**Expected behavior:** 
I expect the file to be grayed in the Project treeview, be it in the .gitignore file or in my ~/.gitignore_global file

**Actual behavior:** _What actually happens_
In the Project treeview, the file was grayed when the line was in the .gitignore file
Then cutting this line and putting the profile ~/.gitignore_global file make the file appear as an "not-ignore" file in the Project treeview

**Reproduces how often:**
Systematically

### Versions

**Plugin:** 
2.1.1

**IDE:** 
PyCharm Community Edition 2017.2.1

**OS:** 
macOS Sierra 10.12.6

### Additional Information
None
Thx for your support ;)

issues.title: Incompatible with IDEA 2017.2.2
issues.body:
Hello, after updating to IDEA 2017.2.2 I have the following error displayed : 
```
Plugin Error
Problems found loading plugins:
The following plugins are incompatible with the current IDE build: .ignore
```

Without any more details. The plugin is then automatically disabled by IDEA.
I tried with the plugin version from the IntelliJ repository (1.7.6) and the latest version from Github (2.0.4) with the same error.

IDEA Build information from Help/About: 
```
IntelliJ IDEA 2017.2.2
Build #IU-172.3757.52, built on August 15, 2017
JRE: 1.8.0_152-release-915-b10 amd64
JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
Windows 10 10.0
```

[Edit] : sorry, this is the same bug as #408, you can close this one...

issues.title: The following plugins are incompatible with the current IDE build: .ignore
issues.body:
I am using the following intellij version
IntelliJ IDEA 2017.2.2
Build #IC-172.3757.29, built on August 8, 2017
JRE: 1.8.0_152-release-915-b10 x86_64
JVM: OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM by JetBrains s.r.o
Mac OS X 10.12.6


I have tried after installing the latest v2.0.4 (2017-07-31)

issues.title: FileStatusManager.getStatus is slow after installing the plugin
issues.body:
IDE calls getStatus very-very often, e.g. for every icon rendered in project view so the method should be really fast.

In CPU snapshot attached to https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-176946 (private customer issue) 20s of getStatus calculation is spent in 
mobi.hsz.idea.gitignore.vcs.IgnoreFileStatusProvider.getFileStatus(VirtualFile).

There are several problems with the method according the snapshot:
- There is disk access for IgnoreFilesIndex.getKeys(myProject) (10s) and it is called for every isIgnored calculation. The (short term) suggestion is to cache the same value.
- There is disk access for IgnoreFilesIndex.getEntries(Project, IgnoreFileType) (4s), I suspect that some entries are not relevant to the project and proper set of ignore files for project can be calculated once and cached as well
- There is 2s in java.util.regex.Matcher.matches(), there is O(N) number of .gitignore patterns (probably some char trie can help)
- Also there is 1.5s in getOuterFiles(Project)

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #415 - search for pattern's parts before executing regex matcher
#415 - obtain covered entries in batch operation

EAP info:

IntelliJ IDEA 2017.2.2 EAP
Build #IU-172.3757.5, built on August 1, 2017
```

Error message:
```
Plugin Error
Problems found loading plugins:
The following plugins are incompatible with the current IDE build: .ignore
```

issues.title: Plugin slows down machine
issues.body:
Hello,

I'm using this plugin for several years now and am pretty satisfied. However, since PhpStorm 2017.2 I have massive performance problems. My machine stops for a second every five seconds where I can't do anything. Scrolling is lagging, no autocompletion etc. When I open the "Open file" dialog it takes seconds till it opens.

First I thought it's because of the Symfony Plugin, but I disabled the plugins one by one and only after disabling this plugin, PhpStorm ran smoothly again. As I said, this problem only exists since the last few updates of PhpStorm, never had problems with it.

Is there a way you can confirm this @hsz ? Because I'd hate to leave it disabled, but it's currently the only way to guarantee a good performance.

I invalidated caches already ofc.

issues.title: "Outer" ignore rules include extraneous files
issues.body:
(Windows)

My project is at `D:\CAD97\Documents\Code\Rust\project`. This plugin is displaying 55 "Outer ignore rules" from `~/.cargo/registry/src/.../.gitignore` where `~` is `C:\Users\CAD97\` and `C:\Users\CAD97\.cargo` is a symlink to `D:\CAD97\.cargo`.

As neither `D:\CAD97\.cargo` nor `C:\Users\CAD97\.cargo` nor `~/.cargo` are a parent of `D:\CAD97\Documents\Code\Rust\project`, I am not exactly certain why these files got picked up by the plugin as outer `.gitignore` files.

This started happening upon updating the plugin (to v2.0.4). I was on 1.7.6 previously (the previous version in the JetBrains Plugin Repository).

issues.title: Ignored files found that are tracked
issues.body: Ignored files found that are tracked: .ignore plugin found some files that are tracked with Git which are also listed in .gitignore file.

issues.title: .ignore Plugin causes too many Threads hang / crash dump in phpstorm
issues.body:
Hi,

I encountered an issue with your newest version of your plugin. I think since the last .ignore update it causes phpstorm randomly after maximazing the IDE window again an too many Threads hang issue or better saying an thread crash dump log.
This is especially feelable, when you maximize phpstorm again and it hangs for at least 3 seconds. In very hard cases I also needed to kill the IDE process completely. I am not sure which SIGTERM Signal it was exactly when I needed to kill it by hand, because I am / was using phpstorm under Mac OS X and I did it graphically.
After getting in touch with the JetBrains support, we found out, that it is clearly addressable to your plugin. After disabling it and working as usually two days without it, everything worked fine - no hangs.

Here is the original JetBrains board topic to it: https://intellij-support.jetbrains.com/hc/en-us/community/posts/115000467630-phpstorm-hangs-sometimes-when-maximizing-the-IDE-again

And in the attachments you can find the logging files and crash dump files from about two days.


Thank you very much for creating awesome openSource Software! :-)

I hope this helps to resolve the problem, so that I can use the plugin again on my Mac.

PS: I was using phpstorm 2017.1.4 as this issue appeared. But I don't think that this changes anything on the issue itself, because your plugin wasn't been updated since then. Also, I didn't update phpstorm during the whole JetBrains support request. So, I used from the beginning until the end only phpstorm 2017.1.4 on MacOS Sierra Version 10.12.5

[threadDumps-2days.zip](https://github.com/hsz/idea-gitignore/files/1164692/threadDumps-2days.zip)

[idea.log.zip](https://github.com/hsz/idea-gitignore/files/1164693/idea.log.zip)

issues.title: Handling of multi module project with parent and children in separate git repos
issues.body:
I have a multi module IntelliJ project which looks like:

```
my-app
├── pom.xml
├── .gitignore
├── auth-server
│   └── src/main/java
│   └── pom.xml
│   └── .gitignore
├── api-server
│   └── src/main/java
│   └── pom.xml
│   └── .gitignore
└── web-client
    └── src/main/js
    └── src/main/css
    └── pom.xml
    └── .gitignore
```

Parent is a Java project with a couple of child modules.

The parent *.gitignore* obviously ignores the child modules already in their own git repos so I'm not committing them twice:

ie.

    api-server/
    auth-server/
    web-client/

The *.ignore* plugin throws up *You are editing file which is ignored* for any child module source code even though the child git repo is different to the parent's and hence should not inherit the parent *.gitignore* rules.

* How should the plugin be handling this scenario?
* Is there any sort of work around?

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #383 - Handle multiple submodules in project (reset parent rules)

.gitignore starts to mark files after any editing operation in .gitignore file.
Is there any configuration to apply it on startup?

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #379 - Files are not marked at startup

issues.title: .dockerignore file will not open in PHPStorm and icon has ?
issues.body:
**Issue:**
.dockerignore files created using the .ignore plugin show in the tree but the icon firstly shows a file with a overlaying question mark (?), each time i try to open the .dockerignore file generated i just get a flashing loading icon with no result.
Screen grab of issue: https://youtu.be/Sd2RVIfr2Bc

**Platform:**
Edition: Windows 10 Pro
Version: 1607
OS Build: 14393.1358

**IDE:** 
PhpStorm 2016.3.3
Build #PS-163.13906.21, built on March 8, 2017

**Steps taken:**
1) Checked .ignore plugin for updates (up to date)
2) Checked IDE for updates (up to date)
3) Manually updated .ignore plugin to Version: 2.0.0-rc.1 (Same issues)
4) Checked for windows updates (up to date)
5) Restarted machine & all applications fully.

**How to replicate**
1) Install .ignore plugin
2) Right click on project tree root directory > New > .ignore file > select ".dockerignorefile (Docker)"
3) Check icon of newly created .dockerignore file to see if you get file icon with a question mark (?) or correct docker icon.
4) Try to open .dockerignore file in PHPStorm IDE without a flashing loading icon.
5) Confirm if file opens in the IDE (Mine do not ever open in PHP Storm) (I can open in another IDE i.e. Brackets, so ruling out corrupt file in my eyes.)

issues.title: Why are some project files randomly showing up as ignored after installing .gitignore plugin for PhpStorm
issues.body:
I added the .gitignore plugin to PhpStorm a few weeks ago and out of the blue one of my project files turns grey in the project bar.

This happens randomly like one or two files a day on average. They weren't being ignored before but now they are although I haven't changed anything in the .gitignore file or any other Git configuration file.

Has this happened to anyone else? Has anyone figured out what's going on?

issues.title: false positive: Ignored files found that are tracked
issues.body:
I have the following entries in .gitignore

```
frontend/node_modules/
!frontend/node_modules/clarity-angular/
!frontend/node_modules/clarity-ui/
```

But the plugin reports the following alarm 

> Ignored files found that are tracked: .ignore plugin found some files that are tracked with Git which are also listed in .gitignore file.

Click the _Show Detail_ link, and I find that it's about the files under `frontend/node_modules/clarity_angular` and  `frontend/node_modules/clarity-ui/`.

Besides, there are many _entry is never used_ alarms in the file which meaning is unsure.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3956876/26038554/ab144726-393d-11e7-9c22-5803d2228313.png)

Did I understand something wrong?

issues.title: Incorrect "You are editing file which is ignored" for non vcs ignore files
issues.body:
My project has both `.gitignore` and `.dockerignore` files.

The `.dockerignore` file lists quite a lot of files that are just not needed for docker, but are still part of the project, tracked in git, etc.

It seems that only the `gitignore` (or related svn/etc) files should trigger the "You are editing file which is ignored" flag, everything else, eg `dockerignore`, `npmignore` shouldn't cause this.

issues.title: Right click file list menu slowed down
issues.body:
When right clicking a element in the file tree menu the right click menu takes 5-10 seconds to open.
The project this happened in is a pretty large node + episerver (csharp) project, which has 40000 files, only 700 of which are not ignored.
Using latest webstorm and had just installed plugin.

issues.title: "You are editing file which is ignored" warning after upgrading to IDEA 2017.1
issues.body:
I'm getting `.i* You are editing file which is ignored` warnings for random files after I upgraded to IntelliJ IDEA 2017.1. The warning might disappear when restarting IDEA, but it might also reappear for one or more different files.

The files in case are not ignored and they show up in git as expected.

issues.title: Invalid "found ignored files included in git"
issues.body:
I have a project with a "temp directory" which I want to include but NOT include any files within it EXCEPT for `.gitinclude` file. (so it preserves the directory)

So my `.gitignore` looks like this:

```
#Ensure the files directory is included, but not the contents
tempFiles
!.gitinclude
```

**/tempFiles**
-> **.gitinclude**
-> _otherTempFile.xml_
-> _otherTempFile.xml_
-> _otherTempFile.xml_

However, the plugin is erroneously thinking that `.gitinclude` is supposed to be ignored rather than specifically `un-ingnored`

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #350 Fixed handling excluding (!) entries, listening for VFS changes

issues.title: Directory in .gitignore only showing as ignored if it is at project root
issues.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create 2 directories "vendor" and "public/vendor" with an empty file in each vendor directory
2. add line "vendor/" to .gitignore

What is the expected result?
Both root-level vendor and public/vendor as well as contents are displayed as ignored (greyed out) in project browser.

What happens instead?
root-level vendor directory and contents are displayed as ignored but public/vendor is not, even though git status shows no changes to commit

[https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WI-35443](https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WI-35443)

![screenshot from 2017-03-17 10-15-02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/977752/24052419/04e720c8-0afb-11e7-9435-13afaf829e54.png)

issues.title: Plugin marking included files as ignored
issues.body:
Since upgrading to the latest version of this (very useful!) plugin, I'm getting warnings that some files are ignored by git that actually aren't. 
This occurs when I use blocks like this in my .gitignore:

```
wp-content/plugins/*
!wp-content/plugins/plugin-to-include-anyway
!wp-content/plugins/another-exception
```

For now I have turned off the 'Inform about ignored files that are still tracked' and 'Inform about editing ignored file' options.
This is probably similar to issue #340, but I'm creating a separate issue since this is a different syntax that isn't understood properly.

issues.title: .ignore doesn't understand leading / on directory name properly (for .gitignore)
issues.body:
My .gitignore file has this line:
```
/build/
```
which should only match a top-level build directory, and my project has this directory at the root level:
```
misc/build/
```
Using the .ignore plugin, I get this message:
```
 Ignored files found that are tracked: .ignore plugin found some files that are tracked with Git which are also listed in .gitignore file
```
about all the files in `misc/build/` and its subdirectories.  But `git check-ignore` and `git status --ignored` correctly show all the files in in misc/build as _not_ ignored.  So apparently the .ignore plugin has its own logic for what files are ignored rather than using git's.  Can it just use git's?

(By the way, I'm running .ignore 1.7.6 of 2017 Feb 23 in the latest PyCharm: PY-163.10154.50, JRE 1.8.0_112-release-408-b6x64 JetBrains s.r.o, OS Mac OS X(x86_64) v10.12.3 unknown, screens 2560x1440, 2560x1440.)

issues.title: Remove untracked files doesn't properly quote names
issues.body:
When the plugin prompts removing files from Git because they are untracked (i.e. have been committed then added to .gitignore) the plugin nicely prompts that it can remove them. However, the commands it prompts don't quote the files correctly, so the commands fail silently if there are any spaces in the filenames.

Example commands:

```
git rm --cached --force .ipynb_checkpoints/Client Rejections-checkpoint.ipynb
git rm --cached --force .ipynb_checkpoints/CUSUM wrong...-checkpoint.ipynb
git rm --cached --force .ipynb_checkpoints/Rejection Count-checkpoint.ipynb
```

If you actually run these commands, they fail because of the spaces in filenames.

issues.title: Gray out folder in Project panel
issues.body: Most of my ignored files and folders display as gray in the project panel, as they should.  However, I added one entry to my `.git/info/exclude` file, and the folder it indicates is not grayed out like everything else that should be ignored.  The `.git/info/exclude` file shows up in the "Outer ignore rules" pane correctly, but entries from it just are not grayed out.

issues.title: .ignore plugin update notification appears every time a new project is opened
issues.body:
## **Issue Details**

I just installed the latest .ignore plugin version 1.7.4 and restarted the IDE. After this every time I open a project, IDE shows plugin update notification popup.

This notification should be displayed only the first time plugin (or new version of the plugin) is installed but it is being displayed even after several restarts.

![Update Notification](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13585883/22917794/e81b44e4-f2ac-11e6-887a-b688d559020e.png)

## **Version Information**

**Plugin Version:** v1.7.4
**IntelliJ Version:** v2017.1 EAP (171.3019.7)
and
**IntelliJ Version:** v2016.3.4

commitsDetails.commitMessage: release v1.7.5 - quickfix for #311 - update notification always visible

issues.title: Tracking of ignored files showing false positives.
issues.body:
Received notice that

`Ignored files found that are tracked: .ignore plugin found some files that are tracked with Git which are also listed in .gitignore file.`

However, the file being highlighted is gradle-wrapper.jar which is in my .gitignore file as this:

```
# Avoid ignoring Gradle wrapper jar file (.jar files are usually ignored)
!gradle-wrapper.jar
```

Earlier I also noticed that `log4j2.properties` file which is in my build folder was similarly being marked. It is of course included in git in the main project, and my build folder is added to .gitignore, so this rule seems a little confused.

issues.body:
![screenshot - 06_02_2017 01_07_28](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2150068/22631243/d0a3f40a-ec08-11e6-83a6-9273c6815906.png)

In this case, the images/ folder in project root is correctly colored as ignored, but the images folder in the font folder, despite being ignored by git is not correctly colored.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #296 - Fixed ignore rules builder to cover subdirectories

issues.title: Files ignored but still tracked
issues.body:
With Git, when a file is tracked and then added to `.gitignore` (or whatever ignore list), the file remains tracked until it is completely removed, making the ignore entry ineffective by then. If one edits the file, `git status` will still report the file as modified and allow to commit the changes.

The problem is that the .ignore plugin shows such file as ignored in the IDE despite it's not. Would it be possible to not show the file as ignored as long as it is tracked by Git? Or create a new file status in the IDE to distinguish it from files that are actually ignored?

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #295 - util.exec.parsers cleanup, TrackedIndexedFilesComponent, Notify util class, tracked-ignored files lookup
#295 - implemented node decorator to mark tracked&ignored entries in project view, debounced calls for tracked&ignored data
#295 - untrack files action, present ignored & tracked with regular VCS coloring + gray annotation
#295 - addColoredText util method, add colorded text in tree view if ignored files are hidden
#295 - show hidden files amount, ignored&tracked gray labels
#295 - code cleanup, fixed labels rules, cache refresh review
#295 - show tracked notification once per session
#295 - inform bubble can be disabled with settings, ignored&tracked files fetching fix

issues.title: Files that are added to repo shouldn't be highlighted as ignored
issues.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Add filter to .gitignore (eg **/*.js)
2. Manually add file to repo (git add test.js)

What is the expected result?
Filename will not be colored grey

What happens instead?
Filename is highlighted as ignored

issues.title: High CPU usage
issues.body: Opening a .gitignore file while using this plugin (version 1.6) with OS X 10.11.1 and PhpStorm 2016.3 results with high CPU usage. Please let me know what other info you need to help in debugging.

issues.title: Any plan to support Stylint(.stylintignore)?
issues.body:
`stylint` is not `stylelint`, `postcss` doesn't support `stylus` so linting `.styl` files is not covered by `stylelint`.

`.stylintignore` https://github.com/SimenB/stylint#stylintignore

commitsDetails.commitMessage:
Merge pull request #277 from hsz/256-freeze-report-with-ExternalExec

#256 - fixed freeze report in ExternalExec

issues.title: The subfolder won't effected by .gitignore config file.
issues.body:
I've writen a .gitigore file and installed your plugin, it was very clear for use that those files or folders are turned into grey color, but i saw that subfolder won't effected, for example, i want to ignore all build folder, so i wrote a "build/" to .gitignore file, and i saw the first top build folder is turned into grey, but except the subfolder of my Client model, see the screenshot below, could you improve this?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12027816/18428701/10dbb4e2-7902-11e6-8bd9-61fbd9c3603c.png)

issues.title: With update to IdeaC 163.3983.4
issues.body:
Hi

Today I accepted the update to Build #IC-163.3983.4, built on September 7, 2016.

But then opening a project with a .gitignore, I have to disable the plugin because of an error:

issues.title: Ignored files in project explorer only colored after editing .gitignore file
issues.body:
I'm running Ubuntu 16.04 and IntelliJ 2016.2 and the .ignore plugin version 1.5.

When I open an existing project, ignored files are only colored grey inside the project explorer once I edit the _.gitignore_ file. 

Before editing:
![screenshot from 2016-07-28 10-31-29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5088104/17206109/80f48362-54ae-11e6-90b3-1322918acf37.png)

After inserting a whitspace:
![screenshot from 2016-07-28 10-32-29](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5088104/17206131/9e3bec58-54ae-11e6-81cf-341a1aa70416.png)

Merge pull request #278 from hsz/246-coloring-problem-at-startup

#246 - coloring problem at project startup

Merge pull request #243 from hsz/240-OuterIgnoreLoaderComponent-getOuterFiles-NotNull

Fixed #240 - OuterIgnoreLoaderComponent.getOuterFiles must not return…

issues.title: Setting "Enable ignoring" does not really work
issues.body: I have a .dockerignore file which ignores all files except for one build artifact. I have unchecked "Enable ignoring" for Docker in Settings - Version Control - Ignore Files Support - Languages settings. Right after I do that everything is good. However soon Idea starts displaying names of all project files in gray, as if they are ignored. Checking and unchecking the checkbox fixes the issue, but soon it appears again.

issues.title: Webstorm freeze after update
issues.body:
Hi,
After the recent Webstorm update to version 2016.1.3 I've been experiencing a problem which freezes the IDE. As it turns out, it was caused by the Ignore plugin.

Here's the original issue from Jetbrains youtrack:
https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-21883

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #233 - Refactoring of the external executable process

issues.title: "is covered by" is wrong
issues.body:
Running version 1.4.1 now.

This warning is giving false positives:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1112998/15512599/9914f996-2195-11e6-9d78-6cdb56000288.png)

`~$` is _not_ covered by `(?<![^/])\.` nor `^node_modules/`.

Most of those "entry is never used" warnings are wrong too actually.

issues.title: NoSuchMethodError: in version 1.4
issues.body:
This error occurs every time the editor is modified for the .gitignore file. (e.g. clicking somewhere).

```
NoSuchMethodError: com.intellij.util.containers.ContainerUtil.intersection(Ljava/util/Collection;Ljava/util/Collection;)Ljava/util/List;
```

PHPstorm 2016.1.1

issues.title: Subfolders recognizion
issues.body:
I'm not 100% sure that this is actually a bug but I will expose it and just open a bit of discussion maybe.

I just found that when you define subfolders to be ignored but you don't especifically say it. It doesn't represent correctly the ignored files , check the image for example [image](http://postimg.org/image/5vzo2j0af/).

But if you actually specify it  with the \* then it's fine. 
[image](http://postimg.org/image/7edlrab7b/).

In both images I'm refering to line 9.

issues.title: tricky ignore rules won't apply to project view
issues.body:
The only unignored folder in `wp-content` is my own theme (last line). All the other folders (languages, plugins, other themes, ...) and files in there still show as if they would be tracked, which is not the case. I expect them to have the same gray color as ignored items would have (like `wp-includes`, `wp-admin`).

![2016-04-06-201452_1280x800_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1057526/14327773/0e8e89ee-fc34-11e5-856e-ba33eb70b35d.png)

Atom editor is doing it right:

![2016-04-06-202415_1280x800_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1057526/14328077/74377d54-fc35-11e5-878c-b65be6df659a.png)

I don't feel like this is a dup of #174, I'm using PhpStorm 2016.1 with v1.3.3.

issues.title: "Entry never used" is wrong
issues.body:
![screenshot from 2016-04-05 10-40-25](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1112998/14292077/49c3235e-fb1b-11e5-87da-2cccec7a6cab.png)

I think your regex parser is struggling with the negative look-behind. I definitely have some dot files in my project, and I can see that the regex is successfully ignoring them.

``` regex
(?<![^/])\.
```

This regex says: "periods not preceded by something other than a forward slash".

issues.title: Plugin causes "IDE Fatal Error" in RubyMine 2016.1 beta
issues.body:
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Use the gitignore plugin with RubyMine (2016.1 beta)
2. Open RubyMine with a number of projects (so initial indexing takes some time)
3. Click on the indexing info on the bottom of the IDE window (that usually opens a small dialog showing some details about the ongoing activities)
4. Apparently some "IDE Fatal Error" happens and the corresponding dialog can be displayed (See screenshot)

issues.title: Immense X server CPU usage on Ubuntu 14.04 when "global ignores" pane is open in PhpStorm
issues.body:
I'm running on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (64-bit) and a new laptop with an 8-core i7, 16GB RAM and a laptop Radeon R7 370M GPU. The GPU uses a proprietary driver (`fglrx`).

When I use a global `.gitignore` file (defined in `.gitconfig`) and open a `.gitignore` file inside PhpStorm (which then displays the globally ignored rules in a "Outer ignore rules" pane at the bottom of the window) the Linux X server CPU usage jumps to 100%+ constant and does not come down until some other file is opened in PhpStorm (essentially hiding the global ignores pane). X server is the workhorse which drives the operating system GUI and input.

Suggested steps to reproduce:
1. Install PhpStorm (my version is 10.0.3 at the time of writing)
2. Install the .ignore plugin
3. Create a global .gitignore file and use it in `~/user/.gitconfig` (and add some lines to be thorough)
4. Open a project in PhpStorm
5. Create a project specific .gitignore file and open said file while the .ignore plugin is active
6. The minipane with global ignores listed should appear in the bottom of the window

**If** this is not restricted to my system **and** your hardware is responsive then your CPU fans should start spinning immensely right about now.

I'm not sure whether this happens in other JetBrains products too. I'm also not certain whether this issue stems from PhpStorm, .ignore, X or something else on my system.

Let me know if you need additional information.

```

This problem occurs only when editing .gitignore file on remote FTP. I've tested in a local project and the problem doesn't occur.

This problem is present on version 1.2 under PhpStorm 10.0.3. The plugin is working but the error is a bit annoying and occurs when typing something in the file.

Thank you for this very helpful plugin !

issues.title: Incorrect warning (unclosed character class) with syntax: regexp
issues.body:
Screenshot for proof:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1112998/11968650/53f1aa30-a8c3-11e5-9d19-395265e2baef.png)

My full `.hgignore`:

```
syntax: regexp

# dotfiles
(?<![^/])\.

# folders
^plugins/ezc/
^logs/
^session/
^cache/
^app/[^/]+/csv/
^vendor/
^node_modules/
^bower_components/
(?<![^/])www/reports/
(?<![^/])build/
^www/assets/

# extensions
~$
\.(tar\.gz|orig|pyc|rej|map)$

# special files
^phpunit\.phar$
^nohup.out$
(?<![^/])Thumbs\.db$
^npm-debug\.log$
^typings/.*\.d\.ts$
^Vagrantfile$
^webpack.stats.json$

# should we version these files or not?
(?<![^/])dev-dutch-.*\.xml$
```

The character class _is_ closed.

issues.title: Consumes high CPU within project of 200k files.
issues.body:
Hi there! I'm using (well, was using) the .ignore plugin within PyCharm for a large project. When viewing the .gitignore file the CPU usage of my computer skyrockets until I close the .gitignore file. another file deeper in the tree is viewable just fine. If I empty the .gitignore file, so its blank, also no problem. Adding in a single line to the top-level .gitignore file resumes the high CPU usage.

Pertinent facts:
- Project has 200,000 files
- It's primarily a Scala/Java project, with a bit of python that I'm working on.
- Plugin version 1.2
- PyCharm version 4.5

issues.title: "Unclosed character class" warning is wrong
issues.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1112998/9883538/8206fe60-5b8f-11e5-9149-9bead5fe335a.png)

`(?<![^/])\.` is a [valid regular expression](https://regex101.com/r/cR8cV8/2). There's clearly a closing `]` :)

issues.title: IgnoreSettings settings must produce stable state
issues.body:
IgnoreSettings has default roaming type, and, so, shared. It is ok.

But IgnoreSettings. getState implemented incorrectly — changed very often https://github.com/develar/__intellij_settings/commits/master/%24APP_CONFIG%24/ignore.xml because HashMap used. Data must be sorted.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixed #162 IgnoreSettings settings must produce stable state (sorted settings keys)

issues.title: syntax: glob is missing for generated .hgignore files
issues.body:
By default .hgignore files are treated as using regex syntax.
The templates generate glob syntax rules.
When generating a .hgignore file, there is no `syntax: glob` at the top, so the generated file is mostly invalid (all the *.extension rules)

My suggestion would be to always put `syntax: glob` at the top of the .hgignore file.

Version used: 1.1.4

commitsDetails.commitMessage: #158 Insert `syntax: glob` for non-glob ignore types when creating new file

issues.title: OSX template containing `\0` instead of `\r`
issues.body:
Hi there!

I spotted something that might be wrong with the OSX `.gitgnore` template.

Here is the generated file I've got:

```
# Created by .ignore support plugin (hsz.mobi)

### OSX template
.DS_Store
.AppleDouble
.LSOverride

# Icon must end with two \r
Icon

# Thumbnails
._*

# Files that might appear in the root of a volume
.DocumentRevisions-V100
.fseventsd
.Spotlight-V100
.TemporaryItems
.Trashes
.VolumeIcon.icns

# Directories potentially created on remote AFP share
.AppleDB
.AppleDesktop
Network Trash Folder
Temporary Items
.apdisk
```

The error lies here:

```
# Icon must end with two \r
Icon
```

Actually, it seems that there're 2 `\0` characters instead of 2 `\r`, which might break things [as I ran into some issues with git-related tools](http://forums.gitup.co/t/unhandled-character-in-gitignore/278).

I'm not sure it was expected so I'm reporting as it looks like an issue.

For comparison, here is the diff with the http://www.gitignore.io version (which is on the left):

![capture d ecran 2015-07-30 a 09 05 02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1094774/8977538/54e0039c-369a-11e5-8ffc-0402ba7544c8.png)

Thanks a lot for your useful plugin by the way :+1:

Hey,

I am using IntelliJ 14.1.4 on Ubuntu 15.04 in VirtualBox 5, running with JRE8 64bit.

How can I be of help tracking down the core of the problem?

Thanks in advance!

issues.title: Do not parse files contained within directories marked as ignored.
issues.body:
When opening a project where a dependency manager is available (PHP and Composer) the ignore files are indexed within the dependency directory that is marked as ignored by the projects root ignore.
## In more detail

You have a project such as Symfony 2 using PHP's community based dependency manager composer. These files are downloaded to a directory within your project which is then ignored using (git) ignore files. Using Ideas "exclude directory" feature is not viable here as the reason you have the dependencies locally is so you have code completion. Without the ignore plugin this works fine. The issue arises when the ignore plugin indexes all the ignore files in the project **including** the ones contained in directories that are marked within other ignore files.

A side note; I am using PHPStorm 8.0.3 with the latest version of the plugin available.
## Example

contents of **.gitignore**

```
vendor
composer.phar
```

The following messages are shown

```
Ignore rules indexing
- vendor/symfony/http-foundation/.ignore
- vendor/symfony/framework/.ignore
- vendor/symfony/blah/.ignore
- and so on
```

The expected behaviour is that the root ignore file is parsed and then the directory tree is traversed from there. In this case the ignore file would see that `vendor` is ignored and not bother indexing the 25+ other ignore files contained inside.

There is a similar ticket #78 which I thought was going to cover this but it is marked as closed and the conversation within it was not as expected.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: NPE project base dir in IgnoreDirectoryMarkerProvider #115

issues.title: Ignored directory with single asterisk is ignore recursively
issues.body:
I have a project with multiple modules and wand to ignore directories with specific names directly below the modules but not recusivly:

.gitignore:

```
*/foo/
```

Project structure:
- `module1/foo/`  <-- Directory should be ignored
- `module1/src/foo/` <-- Directory should not be ignored

This works when using the git command line client, but the IntelliJ .ignore plugin marks the directory `module1/src/foo/`as ignored.

Here is a sample project: https://www.dropbox.com/s/vm83srx3eo0ogqj/gittest.tar.gz?dl=0

issues.title: Unexpected ignore coloring of nested file listed as a top level ignore only
issues.body:
Just noticed this - I have "gradle.properties" in my .gitignore, which is a root level file and not controlled by Git in this case. However I also have a template version of the file in a nested directory that _is_ in Git. The plugin marks the nested version as ignored, yet Git reports it as changed (which is what I expect - in this case I have a pending change in it). I would think the nested gradle.properties at this point should be highlighted in blue, which it becomes if I take out the entry in the .gitignore.

Example:

![gitignore](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1063833/7245572/5f7234de-e7bb-11e4-8121-14dfed20bd2d.png)

Incidentally the .gitignore inside the templates directory naturally is itself a template and doesn't have a gradle.properties entry in it.

I'm not entirely sure how to get gradle.properties at _any_ location gitignored just to see what happens, but then I don't need that either so that's ok :-)

issues.title: Throwable: Directory index is already disposed for Project (Disposed) PROJECT_NAME
issues.body:
Since the latest update (v1.1), I regularly get errors like:

> Throwable: Directory index is already disposed for Project (Disposed) mathjs

My .gitignore file looks like:

```
coverage
img
misc
node_modules
tools
component.json
bower.json
gulpfile.js
.idea
.npmignore
.travis.yml
```

Any idea?

issues.title: Indexing node_modules every time when I open the project
issues.body:
Hello Jakub

Since we installed the update 1.1, IntelliJ indexes all the files in the node_modules and it takes minutes to finish. The bad thing is, it does it every time I open the project.

Version 0.9 didn't show the same behaviour.

Problem exists on Windows 7 and on OS X Yosemite.

Greets

issues.body:
I have .gitignore file in idea project (https://github.com/vadim-shb/blanky/blob/master/.gitignore). It freeze like a hall when I start typing new line in it (for example: server/target)

When file is empty it works pretty smooth.

.ignore 1.0.2
IDEA 14.1
Debian Linux 8 (jessie)
Hardware is ok(Lots of RAM, CPU-cores, SSD)

issues.title: WS10 RC Memory Leak
issues.body:
Hi,

Just to say love your plugin!! However, according to JB support, this plugin could be causing a somewhat severe memory leak in WS10 RC (and early EAP versions). 

Here is my JB bug report and after their analysis of a memory dump, I was instructed to disable this plugin (and others). Are you guys aware of this issue? Plans to correct? I would love to re-enabled it. 

https://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/WEB-15627

Thanks!!

issues.title: v1.0: "Cover entry" inspection and non-existing folders
issues.body:
Just saw this inspection pop up after upgrading to 1.0:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/750902/6470288/ee3c1e90-c1e2-11e4-93e5-5382cf42e799.png)

If I create the dist folder, the inspection doesn't report a problem. Might also effect non-existing files, I haven't investigated further. :)

I'd expect the "Unused entry" inspection to fire here (which curiously has a severity of "Ignore.unusedentry" instead of "Warning" or "Error" in the settings, see [image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/750902/6470392/bc31d97a-c1e3-11e4-931b-05459c19a372.png)).

commitsDetails.commitMessage: unused entry severity renamed to `UNUSED ENTRY` (#88)

issues.title: Wrong ignore indicator with nested ignore rules
issues.body:
Imagine the following directory structore

```
/foo
/foo/bar
/foo/bar/baz
/foo/ball
```

Assuming these contents for mutliple gitignores

**.gitignore**

```
/*
!foo/
```

**/foo/.gitignore**

```
/*
!.gitignore
!bar/
```

**/foo/bar.gitignore**

```
/*
!.gitignore
!baz/
```

Assuming the above ruling, all sub-directories under foo would be highlighted as **ignored**. Going by git itself however, the excluded rules match appropriately and files from `/foo/bar/` would be added to the index without any problems.

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fix for Wrong ignore indicator with nested ignore rules (#85)

issues.title: .hgignore should never consider 'syntax: glob' as "never used"
issues.body:
With version 0.9, the .ignore plugin considers the line `syntax: glob` as "never used".

Removing this entry (the suggested action) results in Mercurial mistakenly considering the glob entries as regex entries.

Therefore, `syntax: glob` must never be considered as "never used".

issues.title: Files/folders marked as ignored in IntelliJ's project are shown as 'never used' in the .gitignore file
issues.body:
Specifically, I have marked the `.idea` folder as ignored in the project panel (or project structure -- it's the same.)

Now the `/.idea` entry in the `.gitignore` file has a yellow squiggly line saying:

> '/.idea' entry is never used

Also, IntelliJ generates classes into the `/out` folder, and this is marked as 'never used' as well.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/350947/3898910/e4e832e4-2272-11e4-9a26-8c762fc8c3f8.png)

---

Other files in there (such as `/nbproject`, `*.project` and so on) apply to other developer's project structures which are not in the repo. I don't understand the value of marking these to look like errors. It might be more sensible to display them as redundant (greyed out).

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixed #47 handle excluded directories in inspection

issues.body:
In IntelliJ 14 EAP, got an "IDEA Fatal Errors" box with the following details:

Error message: update failed for AnAction with ID=Gitignore.IgnoreGroup

issues.title: "Show ignored files" is buggy
issues.body:
Using IDEA EAP 138.1024 and gitignore plugin 0.5.1.

The title for the "Show ignored files" popup dialog starts with a `"` character and ends with the word "null". So it looks like:

issues.title: Version 0.5.1 corrupts right click on project
issues.body: Since the plugin updated to the latest version this morning, right-click on the project is corrupted. It displays a view named "select destination" and the regular pop-down IDEA menu (which does not dissapear anymore). Deinstalled gitignore plugin. IDEA works again.

issues.title: NoSuchMethodError
issues.body:
Occurs trying to create a .gitignore file selecting one of the template.

`javax.swing.JList.getSelectedValuesList()Ljava/util/List;: javax.swing.JList.getSelectedValuesList()Ljava/util/List;`

No file or line number is reported with the exception.

PHPStorm v 7.1.3 on Mac OSX Maverick JRE 1.6.0_65-b14-462-11M4609 x86_64

commitsDetails.commitMessage: Fixed #7 problem with Java 1.6 and JList - NoSuchMethodError
